page.title: 07CUSTOMS IN BIGGLESWADE
page.content: Each Saturday there is a bustling outdoor{market}in the town square with some 50 stalls selling food and produce, clothing, plants and a wide range of consumer goods. A local{Carnival}is held annually, after the Carnival Queen and her attendants have been chosen. A grand procession of decorated floats & other displays wends its way through the town, and a day of Carnival festivity and fun is enjoyed by everyone. At Christmas time the town is enhanced with coloured{lights}which are cere- moniously switched on each year. These lights are very professional, easily outshining other nearby towns, and really add to the seasonal cheer. A travelling {fair}arrives annually, & is set up in the market square, a relic of the original charter fair of earlier times.
